page.title: 07LOCAL SERVICES
page.content: Charing is well served for a village of its size. There is an hourly bus service to Maidstone and Ashford, with buses to Canterbury leaving less often. Charing has a main line railway station with trains calling at all stations to Maidstone and then on to Victoria, London, and hourly trains to Ashford. There is a Primary School in School Road. At the end of School Road there is a Fire Station with a drill tower in the yard. There are two Police Houses further down School Road, in one of which lives P.C. Gifford, the local Constable. In Station Road there is a Doctor's Surgery with four practising Doctors and a dispensary. There is a telephone exchange and a library in the village.
